column5: Last night while looking outside.. we didn't think we did to bad with the snow fall amount, but this morning, we awoke to this.....   I later took a trip to the Park and things did not look good... Ski doo's were even having a hard time.... Talked with a few people just coming in, and they said it was not good out there… They said they didn’t know if they were stepping in a slush hole or an ice hole… the slush is sooooo bad….They were going out to bring their huts in, but didn't feel it was safe////  Here’s what the entrance onto the ice looked like this afternoon….   A close up……   Don’t go out alone…..
We are going to need some really cold weather before that firms up! Thanks for the report and pictures, I was hoping to get out this weekend but I think I might just wait a while longer.
was gonna head out there in the morning but i think im gonna pass lol
with all the snow, the slush may not freeze.....like last year
BC.....I concur !  May be just the weekend to get all those odd errands/chores  dun !!   Meely
Thanks for the report Shelley !  The good thing is, Terry... no snow fall up North.

Yesterday on the dirt roads I do, the snow made plowing a pain as the ground underneath was thawed causing the blade to dig in.  The snow acted like insulation and it would be as bad if not worse ( as shown in the pictures ) if it was covering an already slushy section of ice.  Be Careful!!!!!

My backyard rink turned to slush after that last snowfall as well.  I was going to try it out, but didn't want to fall thru the ice.  I do have a float suit now...maybe I'll try it.  Oh wait...the thickness of the ice was only at 4 inches anyways...pretty sure if I fell thru, the water wouldnt' go higher than my boots...LOL.

Shelley, the loooooong range forecast for 2 weeks from now is calling for some pretty cold temps with highs about -15 even down here, so hopefully you'll get some decent ice then, if not before.  And we all know the wetherman is NEVER wrong.......
Thanks for the pic and update Shelley.  Guess we'll have to change our plans for this weekend  Joey
yup with all that snow and slush, I don't think my ATV will be going on simcoe any time soon   I am glad to hear theres not much snow way up in Gods country
Guess I will wait till next weekend too, Thanks for the update
